author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Communist Party of India (Marxist) has demanded the Tamil Nadu Government to open more Direct Procurement Centres (DPCs) for paddy in Tiruvannamalai district.

They passed a resolution to this effect at the meeting of secretaries of intermediate committees held in Tiruvannamalai district recently.

“There were no sufficient space to store paddy in the regulated markets in Adamangalam Pudur, Polur and Vandavasi. Before constructing sufficient store houses in these places, tarpaulins should be supplied to cover paddy bags,” another resolution said.

The party has planned demonstrations insisting on these demands in Kalasapakkam (March 30), Adamangalam Pudur (March 31) and Tiruvannamalai (April 1).
title: Add more procurement centres: CPI(M)
